message_1: Suppose the keyword for the Vigenere cipher is "MATH" and the plaintext message is "ATTACK". Encrypt the message using the Vigenere cipher and provide the ciphertext.
message_2:
To encrypt the message "ATTACK" using the Vigenere cipher with the keyword "MATH", we first need to repeat the keyword to match the length of the plaintext message. In this case, the repeated keyword is "MATHMA".

Now, we use the Vigenere cipher table to encrypt each letter of the plaintext message using the corresponding letter of the repeated keyword.

A (plaintext) + M (keyword) = M (ciphertext)
T + A = T
T + T = M
A + H = H
C + M = O
K + A = K

The encrypted ciphertext is "MTMHOK".
